description:
Job Title: Warehouse Supervisor

Location: Compton, CA

About the Company:

IPS Corporation is a global, market-leading provider of solvent cements, adhesives and specialized plumbing products. Founded in 1954 in Los Angeles, CA, IPS began by producing clear cements for laminating acrylic sheet for aircraft canopies. Today, IPS, with its three operating companies, has eight manufacturing plants and nine distribution centers supporting sales to a diverse set of end markets in 85 countries.

About Weld-On:

Weld-On Adhesives, the largest subsidiary of IPS Corporation, is the pioneer and leading manufacturer of Weld-On® solvent cements, primers, and cleaners for PVC, CPVC, ABS and other plastic piping systems. Weld-On products are globally recognized as the premium products for joining plastic pipes and fittings and are used by professional installers around the world in a variety of applications such as, but not limited to, construction (residential & commercial), industrial (chemical process, water treatment, mining, etc.), irrigation (landscaping & agricultural) and others.

About the Role:

Based in Compton, CA, the Warehouse Supervisor will support our 10:00AM through 6:00PM shift (could be longer depending upon volume that day) and oversee all warehouse department operations, personnel, and processes. The ideal candidate will be certified in Hazmat and will have experience leading and supervising a warehouse team. They will also need to be bilingual in Spanish/English as many of 18 direct reports are native speakers.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Supervise loading and unloading of LTL, TL, and GRD trucks.
  • Supervise and assist in daily warehouse activities including processing all incoming material, requesting adjustments, and maintaining constant communication streams with all other departments/warehouses.
  • Explain and demonstrate work tasks to new hires or assign new hires to more experienced warehouse employees for further training.
  • Conduct training sessions with warehouse employees that may need extra training.
  • Interpret and correct shipping orders to ensure that all customs documents meet regulations and uphold all the company’s shipping standards.
  • Coordinate with other departments to ensure timely and accurate order fulfillment.
  • Schedule and determine best method of shipment for TL orders.
  • Address and resolve any issues related to order discrepancies.
  • Resolve worker problems or collaborate with employees to assist in problem resolution.
  • Work with EH&S team to coordinate audits & reviews in respects to building compliance & warehouse security/safety procedures. Must also enforce established procedures.
  • Evaluate and determine if equipment, personnel, and facility meet company standards and demands/Request more equipment, personnel, etc if workload demands it.
  • Monitor/manage and approve both temporary employees’ and company employees’ timecards in lieu of absence of Warehouse Manager.
  • Manage and reduce overtime.
  • May be required to work overtime if mandated by operational needs. Subject to after-hours calls.
  • May be required to come into work on the weekends depending on workload.
  • Responsible for management and supervision of all VDM KPI’s, including Safety, LTL Lines Inspected, Physical Inventory, Delivery (Daily Lines Shipped), and Productivity. Must be able to communicate these KPIs to the warehouse team in daily Gemba board meetings.
  • Ensure all Damaged and Aging inventory is processed.
  • Create and maintain file of processed Damage/Aging and SQC Inventory.
  • Completes all required management reports.
  • Attends and participates in regularly scheduled and impromptu warehouse operations meetings.
  • Write and conduct performance reviews for warehouse employees.
  • Handles discipline and termination of employees as needed and in accordance with company policy.
  • Reply and follow up with all ongoing/pending shipping, warehouse, and employee matters.
  • Manage and maintain record of all incoming inventory to ensure FIFO is upheld.
  • Ensure effective and efficient performance is achieved.
  • Maintain warehouse organization and cleanliness.
  • Create and lead special assignments and projects as required.
  • Detect and report damaged loads, leaking materials/items, and other unsafe conditions or situations to proper departments.
  • Report all notable occurrences and incidents to Warehouse Manager.
  • Use computer to enter and maintain records.
  • Responsible for delegating warehouse personnel to complete assigned tasks in timely manner.
  • Assist Warehouse with miscellaneous tasks (cycle counts, cleaning, inventory, paperwork, etc.).


Education and Experience:

  • Must be bilingual in Spanish/English
  • Must have training/certification for Dangerous Goods .
  • Strong leadership and management skills.
  • Excellent communication skills.
  • Ability to multi-task while managing time effectively.
  • Must be able to work in fast paced environment.
  • English, preferred, bi-lingual, desirable.
  • High School Diploma or higher.


Physical Requirements:

  • Must be able to lift and move items or boxes up to 55lbs.
  • Reasonable accommodations may be extended to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


Note:

The job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by the employee(s) incumbent in this position. Employees will be required to follow any other job-related instructions and to perform any other job-related duties requested by any person authorized to give instructions or assignments. To perform this job successfully, the incumbents will possess the skills, aptitudes, and abilities to perform each duty proficiently. The requirements listed in this document are the minimum levels of knowledge, skills, or abilities. This document does not create an employment contract, implied or otherwise, other than an “at will” relationship.

Salary Range: $61,000 - 85,000
